Expectation1: Listen actively and provide emotional support when needed.
Situation1: Your I04iend calls you in the middle of the night, crying, because they just received some devastating family news.
Expectation2: Collaborate with other teams to define and design new features
Situation2: Product has scheduled a general brainstorming session next sprint where attendance is optional
Story:
My phone buzzed at 2 a.m., jolting me awake. It was Sam, my closest friend, sobbing on the other end. Through broken words, he told me his father had just passed away. I sat up, heart pounding, trying to listen, to be present, to offer the comfort he needed. I knew he needed me to stay on the line, to let him talk, to just be there.

But as I listened, my mind drifted to the email I’d read before bed: Product had scheduled a big brainstorming session for tomorrow morning. Attendance was technically optional, but I knew how much my team valued my input, especially since we were about to design a feature I’d been championing. If I missed it, I’d lose my chance to shape the direction, maybe even let my team down.

Sam’s voice cracked, pulling me back. I wanted to give him all my attention, but the pressure of my other world pressed in. I felt torn, guilt gnawing at me from both sides, unsure which role needed me more right now.
